name: prestidigitation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
magic tricks, especially ones performed in a very skilful way using the hands: Blaine's feats of prestidigitation mesmerize audiences.
very skilful actions, especially ones that deceive people: Through monetary prestidigitation and machination, the liability is turned into an asset.
More examplesFewer examplesI like his sleight of hand work and other feats of prestidigitation.He said that he was using the word "magical" in its stage-magician sense of prestidigitation.Some readers might not mind this writerly prestidigitation.The finale was a punishing exercise in piano prestidigitation.
